message_1: Suppose there is a hyperbolic hexagon with interior angles measuring 120 degrees each. What is the sum of its interior angles?
message_2:
A hyperbolic hexagon has 6 interior angles. Since each interior angle measures 120 degrees, the sum of its interior angles can be calculated as follows:

Sum of interior angles = Number of angles × Measure of each angle
Sum of interior angles = 6 × 120 degrees
Sum of interior angles = 720 degrees

So, the sum of the interior angles of the hyperbolic hexagon is 720 degrees.
